IOReporter_IVars  handleSwapCleanup Instance MethodhandleSwapCleanupDriverKitiOSiPadOSmacOSvoid handleSwapCleanup(int swapNChannels); Parameters swapNChannelsChannel-Relative size of the _swap buffers

Release and forget unused buffers

::handleSwapCleanup() is responsible for deallocating the buffers no longer used after a swap.  It must always be called if SwapPrepare() completes successfully.  Because bufers may be swapped in and out of existance, the _swap* variables may be NULL and should be set to NULL when complete.

# handleSwapCleanup | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ DriverKit ](/documentation/driverkit)

-  handleSwapCleanup 

Instance Method# handleSwapCleanup

DriverKitiOSiPadOSmacOS

```
void handleSwapCleanup(int swapNChannels);
```

## [ Parameters ](/documentation/driverkit/ioreporter_ivars/handleswapcleanup#parameters)

`swapNChannels`Channel-Relative size of the _swap buffers

## [Discussion](/documentation/driverkit/ioreporter_ivars/handleswapcleanup#discussion)

Release and forget unused buffers

::handleSwapCleanup() is responsible for deallocating the buffers no longer used after a swap. It must always be called if SwapPrepare() completes successfully. Because bufers may be swapped in and out of existance, the _swap* variables may be NULL and should be set to NULL when complete.

Locking: The caller must ensure that the *config* lock is HELD but that the reporter (data) lock is *NOT HELD*.
